31fNpXk8T2yaoVc6DWKrDg.text: Best pho in Charlotte! Great new location with lots of room and friendly service. I have pho ga and they were very nice about substituting steamed veggies for noodles, though it did cost more. Excellent lemongrass curried chicken and fresh rolls as well. Can't wait to go again.

P9aXYx5xxgtHwyVNdB99qQ.text: I love this place. I ate here back in '08 and have been coming back ever since. Their tofu is the best in the city, bar none.

KCddQ-Ey5Ss83dsLBEV1WA.text: This is probably is best pho place around Charlotte. We love the broth. Our family has been eating here since they were on central!

U3RRwJWFEFfasyouSGBXbA.text: Great service - very helpful in knowing what to try if you are not familiar with Vietnamese food! Looking forward to going back!

EFmuKizYTVDki57J3uN47Q.text: Awesome food, friendly service. I recommend their lemongrass beef.

bDtrXEUI4uLEil3CMbmCfA.text: This is my go to place whenever I have cravings for good Vietnamese vermicelli bowl with grilled chicken.  Comfort food but on the healthier side. Their summer rolls are just so good!!  Definitely recommend this place whenever you want something really good!

Wj4TNCw7dYWrLt9FhM2OXA.text: I usually drive all the way to shamrock to go to Lang van, however, this place is not only closer, but also cheaper and just as good. I'm addicted to pho and will be back probably every month.

-Oex0Pd1sDvtC3WyyBz1Ew.text: My favorite place for Asian food, wait staff is friendly, helpful and attentive. The menu is lengthy with options for every taste. I start every meal there with the Summer Rolls and end it with the avocado shake. If you have never had Vietnamese, you have to try it. The Vietnamese Pancake is one of my favorites. You can't go wrong here.

_WUNzDZVIaGkSK2jeaFPIQ.text: Service and atmosphere was really nice. Food authentic with good portions. Great value, highly recommend

fV_iMyNPFYFLKK4llNICaw.text: Super service, a lot of food choices, and the meal was outstanding. Enough different choices to hit most people's taste buds.

tyzISnTi6IOuaJL1E1utiQ.text: Ben Thanh is the way to go if you wanna have authentic Vietnamese food in Charlotte. Get their fresh rolls that you can roll them yourself. They are just a little  pricey but they are sure damn worth it!

Tus5HLR78mkgPjercG9seA.text: Ben Thanh has long been a favorite. Their relocation to Windsor Square jus off Independence Blvd is in a larger, nicer space that's very accessible to South Charlotte. The food quality remains the same - very good - and service seems to be even better.  There is a very nice bar and they should have their license to sell wine, beer and sake' next week.  Ad added plus is a large room suitable for large groups.  It's still very affordable too!

qpYaNadbhwVYpwg-ZqnlTg.text: Restaurant had a beautiful atmosphere but  I went solely for the pho. It was very disappointing that they didn't offer chicken pho in chicken broth. They only offered in beef or pork broth. The broth wasn't really that flavorful and the chicken wasn't all that great. I would recommend Vietnam Grille if your looking for amazing pho!

ZKB9ctSMzIUoVFEUZFqHJQ.text: Found my Pho Heaven! Thankful for the wonderful service and atmosphere! The Pho here is fantastic! I'm glad I continued my journey looking for PHo in Matthews because it stops here! A new local family favorite. I got the Shrimp Pho, the shrimp were plentiful and jumbo, the pork broth was smooth and savory, and the noodles were cooked to perfection. I will be back!

048443IiDMDrOCw8jnOxNQ.text: I have to write about the great experience we had celebrating my boyfriend's 50th birthday at Ben Thanh. And give special thanks to Mai and her brother Cuong for reserving for us space in their separate dining area for the dinner party and providing us with amazing service and excellent food. Our guests had a wonderful time. Almost no one other than us had eaten Vietnamese food before. I lived in southern CA before and ate Vietnamese food there a lot so I know that the food at Ben Thanh was really good when it came out! Good quality, great taste, authentic, great presentation. Because no one knew what or how to order, Cuong knew their menu inside and out and could advise on any questions and recommend which menu #s to order from. It was brilliant to watch. Then we ordered appetizers for the table and they came out very quickly and well presented for the quantity we ordered. Same with the entrees everyone ordered. And drinks. It was a really pleasant evening and positive experience for our guests. And we had a nice time celebrating a milestone birthday.

7zfopL2EwyhCVnDK6VeNSQ.text: Finally reached a point where I'm giving up on what I thought was going to be my go-to pho spot. I've eaten in once and ordered takeout probably 6 times and for some reason there's always an issue.  I've ordered the same thing every time: 2 orders of pho ga (chicken pho). Pretty straightforward, no special requests, no apps, etc.  Every time when I get there to pick it up, they only have one order prepared. Waiting for the second order to be wrapped up wouldn't be such a big deal if it didn't happen EVERY SINGLE TIME.  Tonight, they finally got the order right (encouraging!) but then I got home, unpacked the food and couldn't have been more let down.  The $21.00 pho dinner consisted of cold broth that had actually separated (greasy fat film on top). The chicken? Well, the chicken was awful. Hard, clumped together & ALSO cold. The bag of stir-in extras was gross too. Old, mushy limes & limp veggies. The one bright spot? The jalapeno was pretty fresh. I gave them 2 stars because they're very nice people who are always polite. I really hope they'll make some efforts to improve on the food. For now, I'm looking for a new pho spot.

sJUFD7A20owxohb2konEYQ.text: Always great! Broth very hot and tastes great.  Always get pho but everything is good.  Nice staff and always very quick!

lW7IeS3l3sY_0oFxsQFE2Q.text: Arguably the best pho. The broth is full of flavor. I don't care for a broth that's got too much of an anise flavor, so their broth is just about perfect for me. We have been going here for years. The service overall is great and the new location, although farther, is way better than Central Ave.   Things we love besides the pho: summer rolls and the appetizers where you roll them yourself, hu tieu, vermicelli dishes, Vietnamese hot and sour soup, and bo nhung dam which is beef dipped in vinegar hot pot, gotta get the stinky brown sauce though :).

DUYmZ6Wd2O5kiIUEtnJYBg.text: Great food and good service, they used to be located on Central Avenue they need to advertise that they are in Matthews the food is very good and the restaurant is immaculate. We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States

bypIdR1WJck6jTCCLv2Olw.text: This place is okkkk. Not satisfied. So Im pretty sure that place was the same restaurant on central ave, just relocated. Nothing new. Curry was plain looking and unappetizing. It comes with your choice of rice, noodles, or bread. My pet peeve is people who don't separate chicken when putting it into soup. This way, the chicken all stick together like a blob! Its lazy work! What am I supposed to do? Stick this whole blob in my mouth? This dish was $12 and definitely not worth it. Overpriced. When we were done, our waitress brought us our check. Another waitress decided it was ok for her to take it without saying anything. Never asked us if we want cash back. She walked by twice just looking at us but we didnt leave. 5min later, she laid our check back on the table without a word and walked off. OK, short hair lady, you weren't our waitress so dont act like we owe you. Another thing i hate, people who only know how to pick up the check. This is why they never had business at their old place. Never coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States. Blob of blob
Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States. Curry chicken
Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States. Rice that came with the curry chicken

v3HSYi2azUUrhqE1HqSRrQ.text: Had the fried quail appetizer and asparagus, fried tofu, snap peas, in a garlic sauce. Great dish.

gVfSJGnNjBKl-o5VcB9mQw.text: Food was great and we were enjoying it until my boyfriend saw a piece of hair in his food and just lost his appetite. We paid our tab and left . Service was great though .

IKtpGhPKH7MEVZSC95SJxA.text: Vietnamese food in Charlotte is plentiful but not always amazing. But Ben Thanh is one of those go to places. Service is QUICK! Food is delicious and fresh and authentic! I recommended their Hi Tieu noodles for anyone wanting a mean and the Pho here is pretty awesome as well!

n2TSnLEHliQONYwwNQJeiQ.text: This is the place for Pho.  They have a very good chicken with chicken broth pho.  I don't believe it is on their menu, but ask them to make it for you and they will. It is delicious. It comes with all the fixings and of course there is hot pepper oil as well. This is great to add to the pho if you like it even spicier than the jalapenos make it. They even give you a little peanut butter cookie for dessert.

GX-Za0d9T_9m0K-6eedItw.text: My husband and I love getting take out from Ben Thahn! The vegetarian options are delicious, so far Ive tried the fresh noodles, asparagus dish, and the curry noodles -- all tasty and seasoned nicely. The jacama rolls are on point as well!

LBoNPsBWgqheZf8aS9iu9A.text: First time here at Ben Thanh. I had the steak Pho. It was delicious and a HUGE serving of it too. I brought some home for the next day. My husband had #40 which looked like Pho without the soup. He enjoyed it as well. I haven't tried Vietnamese before so I have nothing to compare it to but it was really good. And nothing beat that super strong Vietnamese coffee I got after dinner!

dvufdJU5FOItSd_lHySb_Q.text: Brilliant hu tieu & pho. Happy they've moved locations to nearer my area! Nice atmosphere and seating without feeling cramped, service is good, and the menu is all it needs to be.

M_F2OTgkdJQ-SutpVHu85w.text: YES!  This should be everyones go-to spot for pho!  It's authentic (none of that adding other vegetables and crap to an already good bowl of soup), good meat, and priced perfectly!  Do yourself a favor and eat some pho from here.  This is what it's about.

ImA-rIzCw6XwuyGXnHYqLQ.text: I've only had the stripped steak Pho but it's definitely good. The service was OK, as it took a while for the waiter to come to our table but the turn around on getting the food was fairly quick. They have this neat little section that at first glance looked like something you'd see in a Japanese restaurant where they sit on a pillow instead of chairs, pretty much on the floor but nicely decorated. All in all a good experience.

BUgf4f8cfLWaqBxGeQRA2g.text: Great Photos.  Awesome lemongrass curry.  The Bo Buying Vi is not to be missed.  One of my favorite places in Charlotte.

GKtSRhckjsOahi8iebKRDA.text: Authentic soups- yummy! My family experiments with the menu and we've never purchased a dish we didn't like. The ingredients are fresh and the service is ok. Give it a try--

1QKjKZW9yD9BFiuhV3PAUg.text: The staff are always the same & they are always perfect. The food is consistently wonderful. No place in town can itch that clean, balanced amazing flavor. The imperial rolls / fried spring rolls will make you roll your eyes at any other attempt at a spring roll. Their fresh summer rolls are pockets of delicious sunshine.

F-5DyMhuH719_W0FuVzrPA.text: I visited this restaurant recently with my family as we've just moved to the area and wanted some good Vietnamese food. The food is good and authentic, but the reason why I gave them 3 stars is because I feel like they are overpriced. I ordered just a small portion of plain fried noodles for my son (not on the menu) and they tried to charge me full price $12.95 for literally noodles in sesame oil. When I questioned them they said they made a mistake and brought me back my adjusted bill charging $9.95 for the noodles. Needless to say we will not be ordering those again as I feel like they were trying to take advantage of us. I did order a boba tea as well and asked for not blended and was brought a blended drink.  I decided not to complain, but it also tasted average. Our other food items were pretty good except our pork was very fatty and the eggrolls were overpriced as well as most of the items on the menu.

Hgoyk_Sx8W0w2tgEDooZOA.text: I only give 4 stars instead of 5 due to the value. We order the Bun Tom and it is delicious! Problem is, you don't get your money's worth. You get a very small portion of pork with the $13 bowl of noodles.

BO1NsFP2ufO1jwDRT3AD5g.text: Really dirty place with below average service.  Literally my server sat me at a table with the centerpiece fallen over and the salt and pepper shakers knocked over on their side next to it.  Even seeing that she just put the menus on the table and didn't even try to pick it up.  The bench had rice and meat on it from the prior guest which I had to get someone to clean up, she said it must have been from the children in the morning.  It was 6pm so that's sad.  Once you get over that the food was good, my pho was actually really good and wife's lemongrass curry was low on flavor but adding soy and spice brought it up to par.  Food is a 3.5, rest is a 1.

9_jz8af2Z-upiHmDoAey4g.text: This is my worse experience in restaurant.The service is very very very bad,rude.I am a service,I know you need to greet when customer come in.But she did't say anything,just take menu to table,I say thank you,but she ignore us.when she bring the food,put food on table very rude.Before she leaving  I try to give her empty plate,she ignore me again.......The food there is so poor,expensive,my food was $13,it was 2 peaces toufu,and some peaces broccoli.......

photos.caption: Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States. it is $12，two peaces tofu and little broccoli，no flavor，most important is server is so rude.never go back anymore.

v-0glNozaB_NRL5wwXKZbw.text: We did Postmates from here and everything was really good. Pho and spring rolls were a nice size and very tasty. I will order from them again.

zhT7iodhnWxFsPxptZ2ySw.text: Very good. We had Pho that was very flavorful.  The restaurant was super clean and the food came out fast! Many interesting dishes were served  around us that we want to try next time.        The water was wet.

8RDKeGowZ3osehpkwmec5g.text: The new location is so beautiful and large. I love the large mural on the wall. I had visited the other location and can safely say the food is still the same. I ordered my favorite Pho, Pho Bo vien. It was just the same. The menu looks the same and the service is exactly the same. I took some people to try Vietnamese for their first time and they throughly enjoyed the food and the experience. I would definitely recommend every try Ben Thanh.

photos.caption: Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States. Mi Xao Kho Thap Cam
Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States. Bun thit nuong
Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States. Com Dac Biet

SSoiw9SVeTCAQXEXiYW_Lw.text: I adore this little spot. They have some amazing pho, spring shrimp rolls, and a bar that serves sake. Make sure to eat the rolls with the peanut sauce! Efficient and mindful servers.

Sl188S4cNjO3Dxw26Xokpw.text: The Pho is wonderful, the assemble it yourself spring roll appetizer is wonderful, the lemongrass curry dishes are great.  My favorite Vietnamese place in the CLT.

K5hDYKv_rOTsgNc8nfx9FA.text: Service was awful. He was very rude and seem to be in a rush. there's hair in one of the girl noodles. We still didn't finish order but he doesn't give us time to order and seems to rush us.

NR5L-klyXa2NulC_TCXAnA.text: They recently relocated to this new address. Review their restaurant at their previous location and you can see how good they are. With that being said, the new location is much larger with plenty of space. Not only that but it's in the Matthews area and there's not really any pho restaurants unless you travel down independence Blvd.   This place will be one of three pho restaurants that we will make it our usual. I got the usual side of rare sliced beef with meatballs and my husband got the pho ga (although it is not listed on their menu) There are only two size options, a medium and a large bowl.   They offer bubble tea and Thai tea as well sake and wine.   I will surely visit back and try their other dishes!!

photos.caption: Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States. Thai tea

81FTspFdFTWFLZtQVgN8YQ.text: This was my favorite Vietnamese restaurant to go to when I was living in Charlotte. I moved out of state to work and attended graduate school in North Carolina, and finding a quality Vietnamese restaurant on the other side of the world made me feel very close to home.    You will love their fresh and delicious food! The desserts are always my favorite! I would drive 30 minutes just to buy desserts (che) here.

rP8DeKztBHicK5QGpBsIdg.text: Finally came to try it.  Food is okay.  They have authentic viet dishes but the flavor isnt there.  Portions are smaller for the price.

3_FEeQpQlzibz_eG876gjg.text: I know all the spots in the town for Vietnamese noodle soup, this one makes the top list for me, The place is clean and friendly servers. The soup is done just right not too salty and the portions are good as well. I'll be definitely coming back to this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States. Pho

OJUMYvsBR6xaYt8Ur3uWPQ.text: I've been to the Old Ben Thanh many times before, it's been a while since I revisited there, but I decided while I was in the area I would visit their new restaurant since I heard their new place was 10xs better and it was! The restaurant is so much nicer, and very spacious and clean. I ordered the vegetarian hot pot, SO GOOD. I'm a sucker for hot pot and this surely hit the spot. I also love love how nicely all their meals are presented. Definitely authentic Vietnamese food, surely be back soon! (:

photos.caption: Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States

zCjVbZ8-WQEMV1qZHo6MCg.text: Really like this place will be back soon. Love the boba tea and spring rolls. The noodles are Fantastic

wrRD1L_1Jt83yI22Ebl0Dg.text: The best Vietnamese food outside Vietnam!

r7vTxkhIdvFwU9H9nZtkAw.text: Went here a few time. The pho and summer rolls are the only items on the menu worth eating thus far. I tried other items but I felt it was not worth the money as the portions are very small compared to the amount of food you get with a bowl of pho. Stick with the pho noodles and you will be satisfied.

YWxHzBKGYvkF0Y11gwnmcQ.text: I've been coming to this authentic Vietnamese restaurant for years. Everything is the way it should be, from the fried rolls to the pho. My sister gets the curry, and I get either pho bo kho (Vietnamese beef stew.. Not on the menu but it's the only place in town that does it right!), or a noodle entree.  Just visited the new Matthews location for the first time. I really like it. The chandelier when you walk in is gorgeous! I kind of preferred the old locations vibe better but eh, what can I say. I like moderately lit places (it's brighter at the new one).   Keep up the great work guys!  I'll follow this place around no matter where their location takes them, haha!

photos.caption: Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States. Love how they package everything separately so it doesn&#39;t get gross, and all of the pho extras - lemon, salt+pepper, bean sprouts, etc
Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States. Pho bo kho take out!

_iERw-4GfvLpdiAVAh01VA.text: The Pho was excellent.   Very clean place and the service is prompt and friendly. Just traveling through the area and I'm glad we found this place.  Good job!

sLepuYpAoTE-O7_RURyTmA.text: The Thai coffee is great.  The servers are fantastic.  They'll sub out noodles for mixed vegetables

WUWoc2PB7_7AlHOuM0hjQw.text: The Bun Thiht Nuoung (spelling?) is amazing here. It's so fresh! The pork is pure meat, not the usual 70% fat 30% pork that most Vietnamese restaurants serve. I'll definitely come here again! Service was quick. Clean facilities.

9QsJfRoJSQvvL003bYVFsA.text: One of my favorite pho places in the Charlotte area. They relocated here which I find a little better than their old location. But the food is great. Boyfriend and I always get the pho. I tried the Vermicelli bowl for the first time recently and it wasn't bad at all.

photos.caption: Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States. Authentic brewing method Viet coffee. Too bitter for me but some people may like it that way.
Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States. Herbs and veggies for pho.
Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States. Fried eggrolls.

SCZpwa5tNDrjRfeuFNyUhQ.text: Was a patron in the former location. Still the flavors that enticed us way back in the 90s. Fresh, hot, delicious. Best summer rolls and yellow pancakes ever.

photos.caption: Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States

U5c1sK23ZZ28jZ-1cRMcPg.text: WOW!  A hidden gem in my back yard, Very good pho. We will be back! Good service, clean and a good NC Dept health score! 3 visits this month and all consistently good!!

8IADfAHsotJrZyEScpXznw.text: If you went to the old Ben Thanh, erase that from your memory completely before you think of this one. It is wayyyyyy nicer inside. And even if the quality is the same, I feel like it's better in the new location just b/c it's nicer.   We've been twice now and both times the service was great & the food was even better. My old standby - the summer rolls - are delicious. Bad news for Thai Taste because that was my old go-to spot when I had a craving.   We've tried the Pho Bo Vien (noodle and beef meatball pho), Bun tom Thit  Nuong Cha Gio (pork, shrimp, noodles, lettuce, cucumber, mint), Com Dac Biet, Bun Xao Thap Cam (Noodles with shrimp, beef, chicken and veggies). Definitely go by the pictures on Yelp and order by number!  Glad the new location is so close to home, I will definitely be a regular.

photos.caption: Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States. Number 37 - Wonton soup with shrimp &amp; pork
Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States. Number 40
Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States. Number 47

nSgEu1Xo0Xy5cv_Raopwyg.text: This place used to be right off Central Ave in Charlotte and because the area was getting really bad they moved near Sam's Club in Matthews 2 years ago. A-freaking-mazing flavor in my special menu selection chicken with pecan in a pineapple. OMG a party in my mouth. The summer rolls we delicious and the fresh mint made me holla. My husband had shrimp curry with rice and I tell you, those vietnamese sweet potatoes had me wanting to rub them all over my face because they were so frigging good. We'll be back. You should go.

photos.caption: Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States. Pineapple boat holds my chicken pecan pineapple dinner. Yum!
Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States. Who doesn&#39;t like lime in their unsweet tea?

AYxq6CmifgTO135G2rM7tQ.text: Wowwwe I got #37 without the fish ball and WOW. SO GOOD. Personally, every time I come to Charolette it's very hard for me to find quality ethnic food. This place is definitely someone's grandmothers recipes. The summer rolls were amazing as well, very fresh and not that crunchy stale feel (happens often with summer rolls).  The sauce was my favorite, it was definitely home-made. 10/10 in my book!!

photos.caption: Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States

-KnbIt0tsFXJ5RUn-rh4cw.text: My friend, Deanna, and I headed out today for Vietnamese food.  We were in Matthews and needed a place close by.  Had been hearing about this restaurant  and wanted to give it a try. Deanna had never had Vietnamese food, so this was an adventure for her.  I talked her into having the PHO.  As a first time experience, how could she not have Pho?  It was NOT my first experience with Vietnamese, but the cold rainy day just insisted on PHO for me too.  They offered it in beef, pork, or veggie broth.  We both chose the veggie broth with chicken added. It was plenty of food and it was tasty.   Next time I look forward to trying their lemongrass chicken.  Their menu was expansive and I found a few things that made me salivate!   The atmosphere  was a throwback to the sixties or seventies, and I loved it.  The adequate booth space and roomy dining area were a nice change from the ordinary.   The very quiet space was conducive to both conversation and digestion!  Service was spot on. I will be back and will share the good word about this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States

kLVx1RQtZvI3vKCpHeyXIQ.text: The food has always been good.   I recently visited after not being there in a bit. I ordered the shrimp pho with clear noodles.  Absolutely delicious!!!  Worth trying if you want something different.  Or looking for good pho!

yV5-CHwbFskgGYaPTk0YKw.text: This is 3rd time we've been...got the pancake...i had to put my glasses on, there is essentially no filling in these, disgraceful to charge money for this

photos.caption: Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States

2l0H0AMhzoa1lUas3-62gA.text: Judging by the pho soup, I'll hv to come again n again. Tasty without being overwhelmingly salty or sweet. Even the bun #40 was perfectly done. Shrimps BBQ'd on a stick on it n the BBQ beef soft n tasty, not dry like most pho places. I'm happy here. It's like finding home 061017:  #26 Pho w/beef round n tendon. Interesting tendon. Was told they received the wrong tendon in shipment. This one looked like a sliced mushroom but the texture was nice n chewy. Never had it b4. Never knew tendon could b different like that. The beef round was tough but that's cuz it's the round. Was told if you want the softer beef that #28 Pho with the brisket is what to order next time. Looking forward!  Now the #40 Bun this time was again very tasty with all the different meats AND a hint of basil which made it special. This bun so far is the best I've ever eaten, really, n I've rated quite a few of them.   I'll be trying other dishes next time. Hope u try this place!!!!! U really will come back again n again. I promise!

photos.caption: Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States. #40 comfort food
Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States. U can still how delicious Ben Thanh&#39;s Pho is just by its fragrance

gC4Jkkjao7qmZ0X4wnutlw.text: The Wonton soup is amazing.. I can even order the fried rice with Chinese sausage... Well worth the price.

GcX4iu2bdLmpFDyohmp5aw.text: This is a nice place, looks clean and service was fine. Nothing really stood out, the ambiance was near perfect, not so much noise and you saw only pleasant faces, however the thai tea was too dark and did not taste good. It is unfortunate that this is the place I wanted to like. Having been disappointed I wanted someone to make it right and called the restaurant, I spoke to Vivian and assured me I could come back and it would be taken care of, now that is great costumer service. Thank you for the hospitality.

photos.caption: Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States. The most beautiful fish tank at the entrance on display.

yS4-uh7X2hWO_UTweRPiyw.text: The food was great. I love it but I'm giving it a two because customer service sucks. The waitress was rushing us to order our food. Didn't even asked us what we wanted to drink. She just came with water in her hands. We were not even done eating and she brings the check and hand it to my husband. Not even 5 minutes later she comes and pick up the check and insisted my husband to give her money to pay for our food. Mind you we're not even done eating and she was wanting us to pay already. The owner was walking around but didn't even say hi or smile or nothing. I don't feel so welcome here so I won't be back. Certain people don't understand that you run a business here so therefore customer service should be your first priority. You should always make ur customers feel welcome just like how you would make your guest at home feel welcome.

3e1Q8ir1F_cXiARiEpf27w.text: This was the most unprofessional restaurant i have ever has the displeasure of attending. The noodle dish i ordered was practically entirely void of anything remotely like a noodle. Not to mention the fact that the television next too my table was running a constant loop of a human rights ad set in Africa. The children in the ad were covered in nasty skin diseases that I was forced to stare at. Naturally i was appalled by what i saw but no staff member found this the least bit unappealing and kept it playing. My friend's dish contained enormous chunks of connective tissue that were hard as quartz. Even though chunks were soaking in lake water they were still so so so so incredibly hard. All in all it was like a seven and would probably go again.

lKW0N7miWfbgB7xgJSOD8w.text: Expensive for what you get. I've tried to give this place many chances but all three times I've been, none of the food have met my expectations. The broth here is not one that I enjoy. I think it's your preference on whether you like a savory broth or a sweeter broth. This is a sweet broth, and the cinnamon hits you in the face. If you like that, then I guess it's fine. The service is okay. I guess everything is more expensive here because they keep up with the seating area. I feel like here, they're trying to create an ambience as well...which you're paying for. Most pho places are just tables and chairs; everything comes down to the food and broth.

_KwMnMpUgVhz3LCWK2X1tQ.text: I tried bun bo hue and hu tieu kho here. Their hu tieu kho is decent. Their bun bo hue tastes nothing like bun bo hue. It doesn't taste bad. The taste is just not right, but if you're not Vietnamese who try that dish kn CA or Vietnam before, you won't realize that it doesn't have bun bo hue taste. The place is clean.

-iVnQJQPmBeNm-RJaTG-NQ.text: I was not impressed with this restaurant. I love Vietnamese food and I ordered the fresh rice noodle and the temple rolls. The temple rolls were good, but the fresh rice noodle dish was horrid. First off, did not see noodles because they were buried under bean sprouts--I love bean sprouts. The noodles were like they were hidden on purpose because they were burnt. The fresh rice noodles dish was disgusting--tasted of nothing but oil. Another person ordered chicken fried rice and said the chicken was good, but that was it. I have read positive reviews, but after "eating" there we both will not go back. I tried very hard to eat half of the portion so it was not money wasted, but I couldn't stomach eating much of it and I do not like to complain, so we paid and left. If I would have thought of it, I would've taken a picture to show how burnt the noodles were (blackish on every noodle).

hHvluOHIjuEgsGzArgum4Q.text: Whoa, Wow, What...From the Hood of Eastland to the ____  ____ This IS Matthews!  That is Right!    Listen!  I'm going to tell you how to Order One of the BEST Gateway Curries, right after this  MeatBaaaaaaaaaaallllllllllllllll   I LOVE You!!!  Flattened Out Meatball on a stick!  DreamFood!  Lemon Grass Curry [sorry No Translation available] no translation, though believe me this IS a Gateway Curry  and.... With spicy Lemon Grass. Served on bed of freshly shredded lettuce and bean sprouts, though I always order mine withOUT the Lettuce and withOUT sprouts to help with ideal temperature 78.  Beef Lemon Grass 79.  Chicken Lemon Grass 80.  Shrimp Lemon Grass 81.  Squid Lemon Grass  * How to Order Lemon Grass Curry : Pick the Number of the corresponding Meat of your Choice, then LISTEN to me... Order withOUT Onions, withOUT Lettuce AND withOUT Sprouts  (I LOVE Onion though in this Dish it is a considerable Improvement to OMIT the onion and Lettuce)!!!  Omitting Sprouts helps to keep the Temperature at a more favorable temperature!  My Favorite Lemon Grass Curry dish is the Beef, Chicken was almost as good, Shrimp was a close Third and the Squid was Good though the Beef and Chicken were Very VERY Good  How to EAT Lemon Grass Curry ALONE Unlike Revenge this is a Dish best Served Hot!  No time for Socialization...Pray on your way to the Table or just after ordering, turn OFF the Phone... Get to the Establishment (as Carson would say) at a less busy time (if possible). Review Ordering instructions from above... Then be prepared to ENJOY  Meat Ball If I could Marry a Food... I Never liked Meatballs until I tasted this Ground Pork with about Eight Cloves of Garlic per pound of Pork a few Spices, put on a skewer, flattened on Cooked YUM!  Be glad you live in Charlotte or you can Die Happy in Matthews!  Originally (when Ben Thanh was in their previous location) Mr. Hoy took Alejandro, Alejandro took me and we both took POPROCK LOVE (September 2010)...I ate here once a week for almost three years, even though there were at least six Vietnamese Restaurant closer to where I lived at the time... New Location : Alejandro and I meet POPROCK LOVE here for a Ben Thanh Reunion!  yelp Review 2000 for the First time, for a minute And the Whole World Sings : Here comes the Sonne  - Till Lindemann verson  3-27-2017 I take my MaleFriennnnnnnd here from Raleigh

photos.caption: Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States. Meatball! That is what they call it!  Delicious, Amazing, Delightful! ! !

xdGHuuKFBaGfSMdyzlE03g.text: Pretty good! One of the only Vietnamese restaurants in the Matthews area. Came here and ordered the fried quail, pho dac biet (combination pho), and the combination vermicelli. It wasn't my favorite pho in Charlotte considering the broth was a bit oily and not as flavorful as the places on Central. The combination vermicelli was very good though - probably the best in the city. Will be returning here for the convenience of the location!

photos.caption: Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States. Pho Dac Biet
Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States. Combination Vermicelli
Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States. Wonton Noodles

QuPtHHTXMOeKeuk7lDzMGw.text: I love this place! Best broth because it has a little kick to it. The service is also really good. Prices are great and most importantly the quality of food is on point

fpxVXhNuFJNvslo92mBwHw.text: I am vegan and also highly sensitive to MSG. There were many options to choose from that were meatless and non-dairy and I asked specifically if they used MSG. The waiter said, "We can" and I said,"No no MSG." The food was delicious but within minutes of finishing, I was having an allergic reaction to the MSG.  I was excited thinking I had found a good place to get vegan dishes, but the MSG kills that possibility.

9bVk6I3BHpnEn8HuCiJRVA.text: YELLOW PANCAKE!!  I wished I lived closer, but I would definitely be here all the time.  Went on a weekday when it wasn't busy and the food was so delicious.  Located in Windsor Square in a hard-to-see spot across from the Sam's club, you can see the main anchor stores of JC Penny, Office Depot, and HHGregg (now closed) off of Independence, but Ben Thanh is neighbors with the Firehouse subs and Cici's Pizza.  The restaurant also has a small private room for large group dinners and parties if needed.  There's also some unique seating along the left side of the restaurant if you want a full experience (booths that box you in).    The menu is a little daunting, but still navigable.  My biggest gripe is that I cannot eat everything in one sitting.  Need to come back and try their pho, but their yellow pancake is solid and I have dreams about it.

s-1tAnugzQeMCFM7-5dGXA.text: Always when I go there I ordered "Pho", I have been there for at least 7 times. Every time I received my pho the broth and the vegetables are great, however the Bean sprouts is always bad. About 2 times they gave me a brown looking bean sprouts, which is still edible but not perfect quality and about 5-7 when I visit there the bean sprouts was just bad, stinky, and mushy looking sprouts and that's makes me mad! I guess if you like pho and bean sprouts then don't go there but when you don't need the bean sprouts then I guess you can go there.  The service there is so so, the women there has quite attitude, the man is really friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States. Pho

AW3umXdaFmfjL_o0w7Q07w.text: As I mentioned on a tip: Outstanding menu.  They cover the waterfront of Vietnamese and other SE Asian dishes.  Multiple options in each category and additional options as to meat or no meat and what kind.  Very clean restaurant and the wait staff is very helpful with suggestions.   Beer, saki and wine are served.  Parking is in the strip mall lot.  No problem.  Vegetarian options exist.  I had the Hu Tieu Xao Uot which is a wet noodle with vegetables, choice of meat (I did shrimp) and a brown gravy.  Did not care for it, mostly as the gravy was thick and gooey.  I actually had the thought that they must have a big budget line item for corn starch or another thickener.  The gravy ruined the dish.  It was just gummy.  Will be meeting with another Yelper later so will get his suggestions.  Will most likely stick with rice dishes and some other noodles.  Good service.  Will come back.  Was a very popular spot for lunch and there is plenty of room for diners and groups.

n-HXAgvLn_oRU41y4BVUug.text: The pho I ordered was okay. Great services!  Plenty of parking spaces. The restaurant itself is clean and spacious.

photos.caption: Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States. Dry noodles
Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States. Pho bo vien

HM6MRk75-VnuD9kjVT-B_g.text: This has become our go-to pho place since moving to this area of town. It's a simple, quality, no fuss place with pretty good Vietnamese food. Pho is definitely the best thing we've tried. The spring rolls are also good. The service can be a bit slow even if they aren't that busy which is confusing to me but you're not going for the ambiance. Food speaks for itself and you get your money's worth. Always satisfied after coming here for dinner and have leftovers for the next day!

photos.caption: Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States. Beef pho

smmmVfsmb-mNsdV3ak2HeA.text: Great Thai, Vietnamese restaurant in Windsor Square strip mall, second trip and second review! Just to update that the service and food was really good Had the Thai pancake again, crisp and light and served with the freshest Lettuce and Cilantro and Mint! Just perfect for a hot CHARLOTTE Day! Please try this place, you will thank me, it is authentic food !

8OUo4R2wsXwmrCobFOo8hg.text: The food here is passable - not great and not bad. Just mediocre but not worth the price they charge. It seems the portions get smaller as the prices soar higher.   The worst part of this place is the service. The service is horrible! You're not greeted when you enter. Someone just looks at you with their brows raised as if to say (but doesn't say) "how many?"  From there you're seated, water is brought out and your order is taken. You don't see anyone again until the food comes out. After it's served, everyone is MIA again. No water refills, no checking up on you, nothing. When you're done, just walk up to the register and pay. That's it. I don't expect grand gestures but the service here is bare minimum. Ask for recommendations? You get a blank stare and told "I don't know what you like so I don't know" um ok.   There's way too many other Vietnamese restaurants around who like my patronage. I'll stick to them instead.

rqGcZeJcA-t9vRqcKGbLZA.text: We were at a friend's house and didn't want to drive too far. I didn't have any specific cuisine preference so just searched all nearby. I haven't had pho for a long time ago it seemed natural to come here after I saw the pics.  The seating area is huge! They have a gorgeous aquarium at the entrance and a nice but not as good one in one of the other seating areas.  To start we got the fried quail which was delicious, it had some seasoning on it, slightly sweet but so good! We had the pho, of course, it was 29#. The broth was slightly sweet but it was delicious. Added some of their extra hot sauce to it!  We also had the chicken lemon grass curry and asked for it spicy. It didn't come out spicy but tasted great. Also got the grilled beef skewers with rice. This was a bit sweet but the beef was really tender!  The menu is huge and I can't wait to try more stuff!

photos.caption: Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States. Delicious fried quail
Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States. Menu page 9
Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States. Menu page 8

RIoS8M3orJCm0L-eqOBHsw.text: Ben Thanh fell off my radar but we are so back together. Nothing like igniting that old spark.  I went with friends and we ordered yellow pancake, lemongrass, curry shrimp and of course the old stand by vermicelli with pork and spring roll. Everything was over the top delicious. What I really enjoyed the most was the quality of the shrimp. When my friend ordered shrimp, I was like, oh god, it's gonna be those anemic, frozen shrimp. I stand corrected.

iSGYXCIrBqDcdCYOtZZPdA.text: Have been to this restaurant many times. They are busy during lunch times but have enough spaces all the time. Usually order rare and well cooked beef pho and it is good! The broth is great and meat is tender. I always order fried spring roll with my pho and it is a good appetizer to start . Just little disappointed with the service as the server forgot to bring my bubble tea.

photos.caption: Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States. Veggies for pho
Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States. Fried spring roll
Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States. Beef pho

MLBfwzSaDZdg7pJmuZ5HPA.text: Judging by the pho soup, I'll hv to come again n again. Tasty without being overwhelmingly salty or sweet. Even the bun #40 was perfectly done. Shrimps BBQ'd on a stick on it n the BBQ beef soft n tasty, not dry like most pho places. I'm happy here. It's like finding home 061017:  #26 Pho w/beef round n tendon. Interesting tendon. Was told they received the wrong tendon in shipment. This one looked like a sliced mushroom but the texture was nice n chewy. Never had it b4. Never knew tendon could b different like that. The beef round was tough but that's cuz it's the round. Was told if you want the softer beef that #28 Pho with the brisket is what to order next time. Looking forward!  Now the #40 Bun this time was again very tasty with all the different meats AND a hint of basil which made it special. This bun so far is the best I've ever eaten, really, n I've rated quite a few of them.   I'll be trying other dishes next time. Hope u try this place!!!!! U really will come back again n again. I promise!  021719 Sunday Near Costco so we're late brunching it here. Service is bad td cuz it's loaded w/customers. No water served slowly, just the basil-sprout-cilantro-lime dish for pho n the nam pls sauce for the bun bowl.   Good to hear n see Vietnamese families eating here. Go where it's authentic...YUM!  So #40 and #41 bun reads similar but #40 is straight pork meat while #41 is pork balls.

photos.caption: Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States. Pho #26
Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States. Bun
Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States. Hours

n-QaQBs-HwBBBtTlxmyVRQ.text: Excellent food and service. On our way to Charlotte we found this restaurant on yelp and I'm so glad we did. My girlfriend had a dish that was served with two pork egg rolls. Usually she's quick with offering a taste but this time she was silent. As I reached to grab the last bite of her first one her expression said it all. A pout I've never seen before made me feel guilty for taking it. I had a vegetable/shrimp roll wrapped in rice paper with a side of peanut sauce . . . very good. Our vermicelli dishes were wonderful accompanied with a sweet and sour sauce that complimented the dish not overpowering it. I'll definitely stop here next time I'm in Charlotte, one of the better Vietnamese restaurants I've been to.

lGcpjMvZkWVF1wwoBM8hLw.text: It's new. Got a late bite to eat. Egg rolls and summer rolls are good. Got the pork and shrimp viet style vermicelli and portions are small. I'm am happy that there is a viet spot in Matthews off 74. I'll be back to try the pho.   More like 2.5 stars bc portions are small but I'll be back and come here 4x per year to Matthews

photos.caption: Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States

SQrr3Gr5TCtOFF2Sj-nTvQ.text: We came here looking for pho, we found it and we loved it!!! It's quiet and the service is spectacular. There's very few times that I've had pho and didn't need to add anything to it and this was one of those times. The bowl was huge and the taste was perfect. I got the regular pho that comes with thinly sliced beef, meatball, and tendon, and yes no hoisen was needed whatsoever. I would definitely come back and get the exact same thing. You can't go wrong with a good bowl of hot pho!

photos.caption: Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States. Beef, meatball and tendon pho! Absolutely delicious!

s6D-1NsEx9GPTv5yxaINvg.text: This was my first time eating Vietnamese food and it was a little hard to find what dish I wanted to order but I chose the charbroiled chicken a steamed rice and the chicken was really good although the rice was a little dry the place was pretty slow during lunch time but it was a good experience

photos.caption: Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States. Number 73 charbroiled chicken and steamed rice

gA5gK0aEjpmHDz3LlspIIw.text: Awesome food. Always so fresh and delicious!  Service is fast and friendly.  Number 60 Rice noodles with tofu is my favorite.

photos.caption: Photo of Ben Thanh Restaurant - Matthews, NC, United States

bxf3eVZNxuRA7-e0FVjXrg.text: WOW!  A hidden gem in my back yard, Very good pho. We will be back! Good service, clean and a good NC Dept health score.

u7hwqpWqo9ZfHEFqqRemhw.text: We are Pho ph-anatics and self named experts, so of course we had to come try their Pho when we got recommended by a friend.  I got the Pho Dac Biet and all in all it was pretty good. I would give their Pho a 4 star rating overall. The broth had a good taste, but for my preferences a little too sweet. The two issues I had with the pho was that it wasn't very hot, so much that when I added in my rare steak on the side into the soup, it barely cooked it even after 10 minutes. I love Pho for the fresh steaming hot bowl of goodness, so that was a little disappointing. Also the steak was not the thinnest cut compared to other Pho restaurants. (not even close to being as good as Doans) I like my steak to be really thin like they cut it at the asian stores, because when I ate the steak it was a little hard to chew through.  The reason why I am giving this a 3 star is mainly because of a little mediocre service. Im not sure if this is because we went at 2pm, which i assume is right after their lunch rush, but our waiter only came to our table to take our order and never again, even after when we finished and my boyfriend had to actually get up and find him to place an order of jackfruit smoothie. I also tried to flag down another female waitress from across the room to ask for hot chili oil, but when she saw me she kind of just ignored me. We aren't picky people, so I just got up and got the chili oil from a table myself.  I would possible come try Ben Thanh again, maybe they had an off day. But even judging off just the Pho alone I can name a a couple places who's Pho I prefer more. Our absolute favorite being Doans on South Boulevard.

VJW2GJudujDzRT_BtOBpjQ.text: This is our go-to regular favorite in Charlotte. We've been visiting here for as long as they have been opened, starting back on Central Ave., and the fresh, delicious food keeps us returning. My friends experiment all around the menu and rave about everything, and the staff will even recommend and have special dishes prepared for them. I rotate between the vegetarian yellow pancake and the tofu with garlic sauce. Both are so good and loaded with good vegs and fresh herbs. I also love the summer rolls, with tofu or shrimp, and again, lots of herbs and freshness! I tried the avocado shake last time and it was excellent. Would give more stars if we could do so! Out of possibly 100 meals here, we have never been disappointed.

IlvKdxTo4wZs1jtExnZrzA.text: This restaurant is next to Cici's in Matthews. It was original on Central Ave. The prices have changed to $1 more but the food I believe is still great.  It was cold so pho soup time & that is all we order. $10 for one size large with all the meats. The broth is always great, wish it was hotter since the raw steak did not cook well, it was medium rare still after 10-15m in the soup. I had to throw it out, yuck. Lots of noodles in the broth with beef tendon & shank, 2 meat balls & thin steaks. Um not enough meat but lots of noodles. This made the pho plain I guess they are servicing different people here in Matthews since I realize there was no pork or tripe in the soup... hmmm. For the pho only 3 .  I may drive back 30 minutes out for stir fried rice noodles. I hope they still make great plate!
